intro: Gethyllis uteana, commonly known as the Utah springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, early spring blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. Gethyllis uteana is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions.
